weekly_top_story.headline: Thousands of Kaiser Permanente Health Workers Launch 5-Day Strike
weekly_top_story.summary: Thousands of nurses, pharmacists, therapists, and other healthcare workers at Kaiser Permanente went on strike across several states, demanding better pay and staffing in one of the largest labor actions in the sector this year.
weekly_top_story.source: Los Angeles Times (via KFF Health News)

stories.headline: CEPI and Serum Institute of India Partner to Develop H5N1 Vaccine Prototype for Future Pandemics
stories.summary: The Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a partnership with the Serum Institute of India (SII) to develop a new vaccine against H5N1 avian flu as a prototype for Disease X, marking significant progress in global pandemic preparedness with up to $16.4 million in funding.

stories.headline: FDA Warns Online Companies Selling Unapproved Weight-Loss Drug Retatrutide
stories.summary: The FDA has warned six online companies, including five U.S. firms, for marketing unapproved compounded retatrutide, a weight-loss drug still in clinical testing, amid a surge in demand fueled by social media influencers.

stories.headline: North Carolina Medicaid Ombudsman Program Faces Layoffs After $33 Million Shortfall
stories.summary: Almost 40 employees in North Carolina’s Medicaid Ombudsman program are being laid off due to a $33 million shortfall in the Medicaid Managed Care Oversight Fund, threatening support for thousands of beneficiaries seeking help with Medicaid issues.
stories.source: Asheville Watchdog (via North Carolina Health News)
